New Records: Paul Skenes became just the second player since 1913 to post a sub-2.00 ERA through 22 career appearances.
Paul Skenes upped his strikeout total to 167 on the year, the fifth-most by a pitcher in their first 22 appearances since 2001.
Aroldis Chapman is now tied for the most strikeouts in a single season by a left-handed Pirates reliever.
Key Match Events: Paul Skenes struck out nine hitters across five scoreless innings.
Oneil Cruz hit a solo shot off Cincinnati starter Hunter Greene.
Nick Yorke hit his first MLB career home run.
Colin Holderman, Carmen Mlodzinski, Dennis Santana, and Aroldis Chapman each tossed scoreless innings to close out the Pirates' 73rd win of the year.
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Skenes expressed that winning Rookie of the Year would be a cool honor.
Joey Bart praised Skenes' performance and his ability to put zeros on the board.
Derek Shelton commended Skenes for his historic performance and evolving skills.
Nick Yorke reflected on his journey to the big leagues and his excitement to contribute to the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pirates' bullpen pitched a shutout in a challenging ballpark.
Hunter Greene returned from the injured list but only pitched three innings.
